text: Diego Bombassei (born May 26, 1971 in Auronzo di Cadore) is an Italian curler. At the national level, he is a three-time Italian men's champion curler. ==Teams== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !width="60"|Season!!Skip!!Third!!Second!!Lead!!Alternate Coach!!Events |- | 1993–94 || Gianpaolo Zandegiacomo || Valter Bombassei || Davide Zandiegiacomo || Diego Bombassei || || (14th) |- | 1994–95 || Claudio Pescia || Gianpaolo Zandegiacomo || Valter Bombassei || Davide Zandiegiacomo || Diego Bombassei Lino Mariani Maier || (11th) |- | 1995–96 || Claudio Pescia || Gianpaolo Zandegiacomo || Valter Bombassei || Davide Zandiegiacomo || Diego Bombassei Otto Danieli || (4th) |- | 1995–96 || Claudio Pescia || Gianpaolo Zandegiacomo || Valter Bombassei || Diego Bombassei || Davide Zandiegiacomo || (8th) |- | 1996–97 || Claudio Pescia || Valter Bombassei || Davide Zandiegiacomo || Diego Bombassei || Fabio Alverà Otto Danieli || (10th) |- | 1998–99 || Claudio Pescia || Gianpaolo Zandegiacomo || Valter Bombassei || Marco Mariani || Diego Bombassei Otto Danieli || (15th) |- | 2002–03 || Gianpaolo Zandegiacomo || Valter Bombassei || Davide Zandiegiacomo || Diego Bombassei || Antonio Menardi Rodger Gustaf Schmidt || (11th) |} ==References== ==External links== * Category:Living people Category:1971 births Category:People from the Province of Belluno Category:Italian male curlers Category:Italian curling champions
